purpose: Enable employees to request company-approved devices (notebooks and phones) through a self-service Power App, triggering approval workflows and integrating with internal policies.

mvp_components.app_details: Allows employees to browse available devices, view specs, photos, and availability, and filter by department-approved models. Form for employees to select a device, justify business need, select urgency level, and auto-populate employee name/department from Azure AD.

app_screens.screen_details: Screen to browse and filter available devices.
Screen to view specs, photos, and availability of selected device.

features.feat_0006: Add to Cart or Request Button

app_screens.screen_details: Form to submit a new device order request.

features.feat_0021: Data Source Connection to Device Catalog
features.feat_0022: Data Source Connection to Azure AD

app_screens.screen_details: Screen to confirm the order before submission.

features.feat_0011: Back Navigation to Device Catalog or Order Form
features.feat_0014: Estimated Approval Time Display based on SLA

mvp_components.flow_details: Workflow for managers to receive approval notifications and approve/reject with comments within a 2 business day SLA.

flow_actions.action_details: Manager receives a notification for a new approval request.
Manager approves or rejects the request with comments.

post_mvp_modules.details: Allows employees to view the status of their order requests and receive email notifications at each step. An optional Power BI dashboard for tracking could be added.
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Extend the Order Request Form with a new screen for tracking to keep all order-related features within a single app, enhancing user experience and adoption.

post_mvp_modules.details: Enables IT Administrators to update stock levels, mark orders as fulfilled, and link to the procurement system (e.g., SAP).
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Extend the Device Catalog app to include inventory management features for IT Administrators, ensuring a centralized system for device-related management.

constraints: Must use Power Apps Canvas App
Data must be stored in Dataverse
Approval process must use Power Automate
Device models filtered by department policy
App must support desktop + mobile usage
No external users (internal only via Azure AD)
integration_points: Power Automate for approvals and notifications
notes: The app should have a clean, corporate design with device images, a responsive layout for phone and desktop, use dropdowns, cards, and status icons, and confirm order screen before submission. It should also be accessible (WCAG AA). Security & compliance requirements include role-based access via Dataverse security roles, an audit trail of approvals, and retaining order data for 2 years per IT policy.
